::The Vok::

The Vok let out an annoyed thought at the interference of the second 
Ikoto, but that was how life was. The Ikoto were a nuissance to it, 
though it had to admit that their offer was fairly interesting.

"Hmm..." it told them while it considered the offer, "Time must stay 
intact, but I must discuss this with another."

The Vok looks past the Ikoto as another golden head floats into view. 
The two Vok have a short mental conference, the second leaving when 
they were done, though it glances over the Ikoto with contempt in its 
thoughts before it departs.

"Very well," the remaining Vok replies, "We accept your bet. My group 
is ready on the planet."




--- In nbwrpg@y..., "rAuq" <rauq@t...> wrote:
> --- Ikoto / Azafroth / Brodak / Uokarase ---
> 
> Azafroth's thoughts again drift along the nebular dust patterns. 
"I'm 
> am pleased that you are interested. Let me begin." His translucent 
> corporal body begins to shimmer as he recounts what he and the 
> other Ikoto had said. "We, the Ikoto, would like to propose a bet, 
or 
> gamble you could say, on the fate of that planet, Earth. We 
> propose that the Ikoto chose a group of sentient beings, like the 
> ones you already have messed with, and put them on the planet. 
> There they will be empowered with tasks, tasks of utmost 
> importance in their minds. The group that the Ikoto choose will 
> have to defeat your group, and gain control of the planet. Likewise, 
> your chosen ones will have to defeat the bots chosen by the Ikoto. 
> If our side succeeds, we will do what we will with the planet," 
> continued Azafroth knowing full well that the Vok knew what the 
> Ikoto would do, "and if your side succeeds, then we will leave." The 
> Ikoto's body shimmers in cruel delight at the game, knowing that 
> their choice of chosen robots was the ultimate irony. Azafroth 
> emanated a cold amused smile. Uokarase buts into the telepathik 
> war zone, and put mental pressure on the Vok representative, 
> "Well, what do you say?" Uokarase's thoughts speed intently 
> around the groups.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> On 15 May 2001, at 6:07, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> 
> > ::The Vok::
> > 
> > If Voks frowned, this one would have. It had been doing an 
important
> > job, keeping track of time, and these Ikoto came along with a 
probably
> > silly proposal and waste its time. But it supposed that watching 
the
> > planet was fairly boring. Personally, it didn't like the Ikoto, 
but it
> > had to deal with them.
> > 
> > "Very well, speak," it finally informed them, "I will listen, but 
do
> > not waste my time. I have an important duty to fulfil."
